attributes.action: support the immediate creation and deployment of a peacekeeping protection force to Chad.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Thousands of innocent people could be murdered in Chad. I urge the British government to consider the foreign policy that failed the Darfur people and send resources to stop this from being replicated.
These are real “Terrorists”, the real “victims of terrorism” If we have an interventionist foreign policy, surely this is more compelling than Iraq, Iran or North Korea. It has happened before – it could certainly happen again!
“The violence in Chad could turn into a genocide similar to that in Rwanda in 1994, the UN refugee agency has warned. The UNHCR says the killing tactics from neighbouring Darfur in Sudan have been transported to eastern Chad in full. 
"They seem to be ready to accept a beefed-up force from the African Union and the United Nations to take control of the borders among them," Mr Kufuor told reporters 
More than 200,000 people have been killed and 2.5m displaced since war broke out in Darfur 4 years ago.” BBC News
